title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING & EVALUAT SYSTEM

description.narrative: 1.4. National and provincial government authorities and civil society have information and instruments to develop and implement child rights monitoring and evaluation systems., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a social protection framework, and monitoring and evaluation systems to improve public policies and social investment and reduce inequity gaps.

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/881 PR 1: SOCIAL INCLUSION & CHILD RIGHT MON

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4. National and provincial government authorities and civil society have information and instruments to develop and implementchild rights monitoring and evaluation systems.

description.narrative: High level discussions were held by means of disseminating strategic, solid and pertinent data about child rights fulfilment during the COVID-19 pandemic. In addition, a Case-Management Information System is a national policy shedding light on main rights deprivations affecting children. Finally, evidence generation (e.g. MICS, SitAn, GR, CLAC, CPE) has been both a core component during 2016-2021 informing decision and a main input for the next CPD cycle 2021-2025. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/07/2021

actual.value: 2020:The tabulation plan, database weights, and consistency & data quality are finalized. In addition, DIRC workshop was conducted and the report is being conducted. Final report and microdata will be available early 2021.
